intro: Odontandra pseudostipulare, commonly known as the false stipule odontandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
